title: Renovated Former Rectory in U.K. Hits Market for £2.5 Million
text:
A renovated period rectory in the village of Michelmersh in Hampshire, England, went on sale this week for £2.5 million (US$3.2 million), Mansion Global has learned.



The 6,300-square-foot four-bedroom house has been completely transformed from top to bottom, after undergoing a modern renovation by its current owners, who wished to remain anonymous.



The main part of the property is formed of a Victorian-era rectory and a period coach house. Formerly two separate buildings, they are now linked by a minimalist glass structure, which serves as a dining room.

The owners—who bought the home in 2008 for £1.1 million according to property records—gutted both buildings when they began their three-year renovation in 2009, adding Lutron lighting and home ventilation systems, electrically operated skylights and underfloor heating throughout.



The extension into the former coach house has added useful additional living areas, which have been “cleverly conceived to offer a series of free-flowing spaces across the ground floor,” according to the property’s brochure.



The glass-clad room has full-height sliding glass doors on either side, which connect it to its green surroundings. It provides views through the house from its gardens as well as a link between the kitchen and the converted coach house, which features an office, one-bedroom annex and studio room.

“It is an incredibly well-executed modern addition to the renovation, seamlessly stitching together the former rectory building and the coach house,” said Lucy Drane, an appraisals specialist at The Modern House, the agency listing the property.



Minimalist interior design features throughout the house, creating a seamless look between the converted and original parts of the house. A muted color palette of browns, creams and dark blue, dark-grey windows and oak chevron wooden flooring feature throughout the house.



The rectory has an elegant period look, created by its double-fronted façade, double bay timber windows and tall chimney stacks. Its grand reception room with an open fireplace, library and music room are set in well-proportioned, high-ceiling rooms, with wooden panelling, which lead off the central hallway.



The Old Rectory is a “superlative space with uninterrupted light and elevated views as far reaching as the Isle of Wight," said James Klonaris, prime appraisals specialist at The Modern House.

The gardens, which feature private courtyards and formal gardens, extend to one-third of an acre. A highlight is the lawn garden featuring a water channel, clipped hedges and pleached trees. There is also a paddock land of just under an acre, which lies opposite the property.



The house is in Michelmersh, a rural village surrounded by beautiful countryside, with extensive walking paths. The River Test flows through a landscape, which features water meadows, rolling chalk hills and ancient woodland.

It is within walking distance of two pubs and sits three miles to the north of the market town of Romney and 11 miles north of the city of Southampton. The South Downs and the New Forest national parks are within easy reach.
